Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 11:39AM Inspireme wrote: Thank God your results are B9!  My results from Friday's (Feb. 12th) biopsy were B9.  Praising God!
Posts.Title: Biopsy today shellbell74 Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2010 02:19PM Inspireme wrote: Shellbell, I truly hope that you receive good news.  I agree with the others here...the waiting game is a horrible experience.  I had a 3 1/2 week scare and that was only because I had to go through the motions of the mammgram, ultrasound, MRI and then the biospy. My biopsy was Jan 22nd and got my results Wed. Jan 27....B9 intraductal papilloma.... I have another biopsy scheduled for my left breast.  Please - Please - Please try not to surf the net for additonal information. You will find yourself on the computer for hours...day-in and day-out.  This kind of thing can stress you out...and believe me, I know....just last weekend I broke-out in hives from stressing about my results.  Please try to do something to kept your mind off of your results...Do know that you are in my thoughts and prayers...and you are going to be fine. Carol

I am now 47.  Thank you so much for your response.  I will share my results as soon as I know.  Thanks again!  Carol
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2010 11:35AM Inspireme wrote: Hi Cindy, You are so right about that...  I develop a severe case of endometriosis which resulted in a partial hysterectomy in 2004...and then in 2007, had emergency surgery due to a bleeding cyst, the size of a golf ball on my left ovary, and had both removed...I am so thankful that it is all gone!   I have two younger sisters and only one of them (age 33) is experiencing the same thing now.  She just had 3 B9 cysts removed...one, the size of a grapefruit and the other two, the size of an orange.
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2010 01:56PM Inspireme wrote: Thank you Cindy!  I am still waiting for the results....constantly checking my cell phone.  I know that when I see the number on my phone, I'll start feeling faint...  just thinking about it gives me an awful twisted feeling in my stomach from anxiety.  So far I've done pretty good through out the day trying to work...however, my mind wonder -  thinking that my life could literally be turned upside down with that one phone call.  But in my heart, God is telling me to trust in him and everything will be alright.... I know this!  It's just hard and scary waiting. Thank you again for your prayers.  I am so grateful!
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2010 12:50PM Inspireme wrote: It's B9 Intraductal Papillomas in my right breast! My doctor did stressed that it should be removed, so I've been referred to a surgeon.  Also, I'll be having a MRI guided needle biopsy soon on my left breast. I am so relieved and thankful for all of you!  The women in this forum are an awesome group of brave women!  I've done more research on breast issues in the last 3 1/2 weeks then I ever have in my entire life.  What a wake up call! I will continue to pray for everyone here.  Please keep the faith... I know that God will not give you no more than you can bare...  and thank you Cindy for having that faith for me.  You made me feel so much better.  God Bless you! Carol
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2010 11:44AM Inspireme wrote: last, I am so sorry to hear of your outcome but, is thankful it was detected in time for early treatment.  I will keep you lifted up in my prayers!  You are a courageous woman... God Loves You and So Do I... Carol
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Inspireme wrote: Was wondering has anyone here experienced some bloody/yellowish watery discharge in one breast? I have a history of fibrocystic disease.  My doctor discovered a brown-yellowish discharge in my breast back in Sept 09.  Had the mammogram and was told by radiologist that nothing could be found and it appeared to be fine.  So I continued to have this discharge only when the nipple is squeezed.  2 weeks ago, I squeeze my nipple while taking a shower and this time blood was present.  Since then I've had the mammogram and ultrasound (which showed a mass behind the nipple) and just last Monday, I had the MRI which showed abnormalities in both breast. I was told that they were going to focus on the right breast having the discharge.  Now, I am scheduled to have a biopsy on Thursday, Jan 21st.  Currently, I am experiencing a slight discomfort similar to lactating breast pain. I am so terrified... trying to prepare myself for the worst and praying for the best outcome.  I know that God will not give me more than I can handle. Let me back up.... A little about me.... I am 47 years old, married with a 22 yr old daughter and a 17 year son.  2004 I had a partial hysterectomy, and 2007, had emergency surgery to have a ruptured cyst and ovaries removed. Since 2007 I've been on HRT - Hormone Replacement Therapy.  My mother was diagnosed with ovarian cancer (stage IV) in Feb. 2006 and died Nov. 22, 2006. Faith is all we need to get thru life's struggles... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bloody Breast Discharge Inspireme Inspireme

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2010 08:27AM Inspireme wrote: Thank you so much for your response.  I will never dismiss the fact that the worst cannot happen to me.  I am truly thankful for this forum and the information provided here from you and others/experts... while I am very anxious about the outcome - through my faith, my strength in this whole process will carry me throughout this journey.  My husband, children, family and friends are very supportive... I will share my results when they are in, and even if they are positive (and I pray they are not) I know that I will never be alone. Thank you and God Bless Carol - Inspireme
